intro: Bupleurum leucocladum, commonly known as white-haired bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white, often arranged in compound umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Bupleurum leucocladum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
